input.label: If you wish to record coordinates from a handheld GPS device, please change GPS Accuracy to 0 m, and enter Latitude and Longitude manually below
INSTRUCTIONS:
input.hint: For this section, consider cover as if looking down from above. Numbers do not need to add to 100%, but should be close. If there is water or snow within 5 m, move away from it. Try to find a location that is representative of the "patch" you are in.

select1.label: Radius
select1.hint: We intended to use 5 m radius, but if a different area seems more approriate, select one that works for your situation.

input.label: Percent NON-VEGETATED
input.hint: Boulder, dirt, litter, etc. Move away from snow.

input.label: Percent SHRUB
input.hint: Woody plants apx <2m (include young trees and low shrubs)

input.label: Percent OTHER
input.hint: If other categories utterly fail you…

input.label: INSTRUCTIONS:
input.hint:
For this section, do NOT use birds-eye-view, instead note if each structure type is present & what the most abundant species is. Think about abundance as the plant contributing the most biomass, not just the number of individuals. Use your best judgement. Use NA when there is no answer, 'other' if the species is not on the list, and 'unknown' if you are unsure.

For 'unknown' species, please collect a sample to bring back to a botanist for identification.

select1.label: TREES Present?
select1.hint: Are there any trees (>2m tall) within chosen radius?

select1.label: Primary TREE Species
select1.hint: Choices will appear as you type, please select one.

item.label: Artemisia tridentata wyomingensis; Wyoming big sagebrush

input.label: Comments on TREES?
input.hint: Describe unknown/other species or issues here:

select1.label: SHRUBS Present?
select1.hint: Are there any shrubs (<2m tall) within chosen radius?

select1.label: Primary SHRUB Species
select1.hint: Choices will appear as you type, please select one.

item.label: Artemisia tridentata wyomingensis; Wyoming big sagebrush

input.label: Comments on SHRUBS?
input.hint: Describe unknown/other species or issues here:

select1.label: GRASS Present?
select1.hint: Are there any grasses within chosen radius?

select1.label: Most abundant GRASS
select1.hint: Choices will appear as you type, please select one.

item.label: Liatris ligulistylis; Rocky mountain blazing star
Hypericum anagalloides; Bog St. John's wort
Sisyrinchium montanum; Rocky mountain blue-eyed grass
Iris missouriensis; Western blue flag iris
Maianthemum racemosum; Feathery false lily of the valley
Smilicina stellata; Starry false lily of the valley
Phlox multiflora depressa; Rocky mountain phlox

select1.label: Second most abundant GRASS
select1.hint: Choices will appear as you type, please select one. Use NA if there is only 1 grass species.
